results.title: Midnight express [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, David Puttnam and Casablanca Films
results.brief_description: A young tourist, Billy Hayes (Brad Davis), travelling in Turkey is arrested for possession of hashish. The film traces his experiences, often violent and terrifying, in a foreign jail and his attempts to escape and cross the border into freedom. The cast also features John Hurt and Randy Quaid with a script by Oliver Stone. The film is based on Billy Hughes’ book of the same title relating his jail experiences.

results.title: Midnight dancers = Sibak
results.brief_description: This low-budget portrait of three brothers who make a living in Manila as “Macho Dancers” or “sibak” (a slang term for male prostitutes), filmed in the streets and in the bars of Manila, offers a rare insight into gay culture in the Philippines. The eldest, who at 23 is verging on being too old for his profession, has a wife and child but is also openly involved with a wealthy older man. The second brother lives a life on the streets selling his body while attempting to avoid the violently homophobic police. Against the admonishments of his mother, the youngest travels to the city to join his brothers in the sex trade. He soon becomes romantically involved with a transvestite and they begin a steady relationship. Faced with the harsh reality of poverty, their mother is forced to accept her sons efforts to support the family. Although the direction and performances are uneven, and the voyeuristic focus on the dancers lithe bodies overly gratuitous the film is an indictment of the abhorrent conditions of crime, poverty and homophobia faced by sex workers in the Philippines. Cast: Ryan Aristorenas, Perla Bautista, Richard Cassity.

results.title: Midnight cowboy
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Jerome Hellman and Jerome Hellman-John Schlesinger Productions
results.brief_description: Tough, potent and shocking; an haunting look at the American Dream - turned nightmare. As Ratso Rizzo, scrounging, sleazy small-time con-man with big dreams, Dustin Hoffman gives one of the most unforgettable performances of his career. And as Joe Buck, the good-looking, naively charming Texas “cowboy” convinced that he is the salvation of many lonely, love-starved New York women, Jon Voight is magnificent. Living on the tattered fringe of society, an unlikely bond grows between these two outcasts that is powerful and poignant. From first frame to last, this multi-award winning film is a transcendant, compassionate film masterpiece that hits right at the heart.

results.title: Middlemarch
results.creator_credit: Anthony Page, Louis Marks and BBC
results.brief_description: George Eliot’s veritable feast of literary delight, with a star studded cast and stunning locations. Early nineteenth century England is restless. Soon the Industrial Revolution will split its population apart - into two opposing factions: the conservatives and the liberals. The young ambitious Doctor Tertius Lydgate arrives in the town of Middlemarch to take up his new position as the local doctor and medical supervisor at the new hospital, his intention is “to do good small work for Middlemarch and great work for the world.” However he meets with resistance from many of the town’s dignitaries. Meanwhile Dorothea Brooke, ashamed of her privileged existence of comfort in her Uncle Arthur’s house, seeks a purpose to her young life and finds herself drawn to the scholarly Edward Casaubon. But on their honeymoon in Rome, it seems her blind faith may have been misplaced… And what of Casubon’s errant artist/writer nephew, the Byronic Will Ladislaw, who is unable to banish Dorothea from his thoughts? He waits in the wings for passion to take its course .

results.title: Middle East: journey into the future
results.brief_description: Depicts the dual life style of Taufic, an Egyptian farmer who, in order to support his family, must leave his village for two weeks in every four and work four hundred miles away as adviser for an oil company. Notes the stresses of the constant change of his life style and the necessity of the work to help the Middle East move into the future.

results.title: Middle distance running; hurdling; the sprint
results.creator_credit: Brian Clarkson, Alan Smith and Queensland. Dept. of Education
results.brief_description: Middle-distance running” is designed to motivate the young to run, with emphasis on a training program that won’t burn the young athlete out. “Hurdling’ and “The Sprint” present a guide to correct technique, and training routines designed to reinforce these skills.

results.title: Midas [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Niki Bern, Isabel Perez and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The classic children’s story of King Midas is retold from the perspective of an adult narrator, with live action and special effects set against a fantastic picture book background. The narrator gets to the heart of the story, revealing the practicalities and dark undertones of being the man with the golden touch. Cast includes Jason Chatwin (King Midas) and Hanna Colles (the Princess).

results.title: Midaq Alley = El Callejon de los Milagros
results.creator_credit: Jorge Fons, Alfredo Ripstein Jr, Instituto Mexicano de Cinematografia and Alameda Films
results.brief_description: Set in a poor section of downtown Mexico City, “Midaq Alley” is a story of several characters, each with their own story to tell, and each bound together inextricably by their inhabitance of this rather rundown derelict neighbourhood. The film is broken up into four separate tales which all intertwine and connect with each other. The first tale “Rutilio” introduces a middle-aged owner of a small bar in the town. Rutilio (Ernesto Gomez Cruz), estranged from his wife and family is about to embark on an affair, the consequences of which will have a devastating effect on his family particularly his son, Chava. The second tale “Alma” is about a young, beautiful and rather naive girl, Alma (Selma Hayek) who is patiently waiting for the return of her fiance Abel (Bruno Bichir) from the United States. Abel has gone to the States to make money so he can come back and marry Alma. Life however becomes complicated for Alma and feeling lonely and missing Abel, she finds herself attracted to the attentions of the suave but rather unsavoury Jose Luis (Daniel Gimenez Cacho). Her life is about to be changed forever. The third story “Susanita” tells of the spinster landlady of a small apartment block in the neighbourhood who longs for romance in her rather sad and lonely life. Susanita (Margarita Sanz) unwittingly and tragically ends up in a “sham” marriage. “El Regreso” (The Return), the fourth story, ties up all the plot threads of romance, deceit, human frailty, sadness and despair into one final act. Based on the novel by Egyptian writer and Nobel prize winner, Naguib Mahfuz, and winner of 45 international film awards, including Berlin and Chicago, this is a fine film with an excellent supporting cast including Maria Rojo, Delia Casanova, Claudio Obregon, Juan Manuel Bernal.
